intro: Libanotis pyrenaica, commonly known as the Pyrenean bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the Pyrenees mountain range. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and protected species in its native habitat.
